docs.snippet: We think it not at all improbable that the establishment of gymnasia at our two principal seats of learning--Harvard and Yale--within the last few months, is an event which, little attention as it excites, will influence the future of the country a...
docs.lead_paragraph: We think it not at all improbable that the establishment of gymnasia at our two principal seats of learning--Harvard and Yale--within the last few months, is an event which, little attention as it excites, will influence the future of the country a good deal more than the "organization of the House."

byline.original: G. WOOD.S.S. NICHOLAS.JAS. B. CUMMING.HENRY H. CUMMING.SOUTH

headline.main: THE PENDING ISSUE.; ILLUSTRATIONS OF PUBLIC OPINION. THE NATIONAL CRISIS. THE CRISIS AND ITS TREATMENT. SOUTHERN EMANCIPATION. DEFECTIVE AND INDADEQUATE SCHEMES FOR EXTINGUISHING SLAVERY.

docs.snippet: We really know no reason why the Judges of the Superior Court should sacrifice their lives in order to gave the City the expense of providing decent, well-ventilated rooms for the discharge of their official duties.
docs.lead_paragraph: We really know no reason why the Judges of the Superior Court should sacrifice their lives in order to gave the City the expense of providing decent, well-ventilated rooms for the discharge of their official duties.

headline.main: CITY GOVERNMENT.; THE BOARD OF GOVERNORS. INCREASE IN THE INSTITUTIONS--THE BEEF CONTRACT--REMOVAL OF THE DEPOSITS POSTPONED. STREET CLEANING. THE EXCISE COMMISSIONERS. PROPOSED WIDENING OF ANN-STREET.

docs.lead_paragraph: The weekly report from the institutions to the Board of Governors yesterday showed that the number of inmates remaining Jan. 28 was 8,394, an increase of 122 as compared with the number reported at the previous meeting. While the Clerk was reading the requisitions, the Board was informed that two more foundlings had been left in charge of the Governors. .

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. JAQUES' bill, now before the Legislature, settling the manner in which the Common Council may make grants for railroads in this City, at last provides that all such grants shall be put up at auction. This is exactly what is wanted to put an end to the jobbery, which has hitherto attended all applications for these privileges, and which has furnished the ene- ...

headline.main: The Attempted Escape of the Murderers.; EFFORT OF STEPHENS TO ESCAPE FROM THE TOMBS --ADDITIONAL PARTICULARS--STATEMENTS OF SANCHEZ AND STEPHENS. STEPHENS' ANONYMOUS LETTER.

docs.lead_paragraph: In yesterday's TIMES we published an account of a conspiracy on the part of JAMES STEPHENS and FELIX SANCHEZ, two of the condemned murderers in the Tombs, to kill their keepers and escape from confinement. Upon further investigation it has been ascertained that STEPHENS alone originated the plot, and that SANCHEZ did not wholly enter into it, as it was he who revealed the matter, and thus most probably prevented the murder of the keepers.
